title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**ORLANDO—History arrived in Orlando tonight, not with a roar, but with the relentless, methodical swish of the net. In a 96-92 victory for the Washington Bullets over the Orlando Magic, one name eclipsed all others: Gheorghe Muresan.**

From the opening tip, this was the Muresan Show. The 7-foot-7 center from Romania was an unstoppable force, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record **49 points**. He was not merely scoring; he was dominating, transforming the painted area into his personal domain. Every drop-step, every hook shot, and every put-back was a testament to his sheer size and surprising touch. The Magic had no answer.

While Muresan’s offensive explosion was the headline, his **16 rebounds** were the subplot, ensuring the Bullets capitalized on his misses and limited Orlando’s second-chance opportunities. He was a one-man wrecking crew, single-handedly carrying the Bullets’ offense on a night when backcourt mates Calbert Cheaney (16 points) and Chris Webber (10 points) provided secondary support.

The Magic, led by Anfernee Hardaway’s 21 points and Rony Seikaly’s 16, fought valiantly. They traded blows with the Bullets, keeping the game within reach until the final moments. But every time Orlando threatened to seize momentum, Muresan answered. A decisive bucket in the post, a crucial offensive board—his monumental presence was the difference.

When the final horn sounded, the scoreboard read 96-92, but the true story was the towering figure who had just authored one of the most spectacular individual performances in Bullets history. On this night, Gheorghe Muresan wasn’t just a player; he was an event.
